## Professional Summary

Principal AI Engineer and Solutions Architect with 13+ years delivering enterprise-scale AI, ML, and data solutions across healthcare, life sciences, and financial services. Architected HIPAA-compliant AI platforms processing petabytes of healthcare data for 50M+ members, built agentic systems that accelerate engineering velocity, and led AI strategy for organizations from WEF Technology Pioneers to Fortune 500 enterprises. Trusted technical advisor to C-suite executives at Amazon Web Services, Microsoft, Booz Allen Hamilton, and Slalom Consulting, combining deep expertise in cloud infrastructure and ML systems with healthcare domain knowledge to drive measurable business outcomes.

## Professional Experience

### Staff AI DataOps Engineer
**Arine** | Remote | Sep 2025 – Present

- Managed the enterprise data platform on Snowflake and AWS processing petabytes of healthcare data from hundreds of heterogeneous sources, supporting downstream ML and AI systems for Arine's medication-optimization platform covering 50M+ members across 45+ health plans.
- Developed HIPAA-compliant AI coding assistants that transformed data operations into an AI-augmented practice — a Data Engineering Agent autonomously generated, deployed, and tested ETL pipelines while a Dev Environment Setup Agent eliminated multi-day onboarding.
- Built an observability pipeline to monitor Arine's autonomous pharmacist AI agent — ingesting production behavior data from DynamoDB into Snowflake, transforming it with dbt, and visualizing performance metrics in QuickSight dashboards.
- Led AI enablement workshops training up to 100 engineers on AI-first development; designed the AI DataOps Toolkit — an agentic framework encompassing governance standards, reference architectures, and change management procedures.
- Architected high-throughput CDC pipelines from PostgreSQL to Snowflake using serverless, event-driven architectures (Lambda, Step Functions, EventBridge, SNS/SQS).

### Neuroinformatics Data Platform Architect
**TReNDS Center** | Atlanta, GA | Jan 2022 – Sep 2023

- Served as tech lead and architect for COINSTAC, an open-source decentralized neuroinformatics platform applying federated analysis to neuroimaging and genomics data with differential privacy protections for PHI.
